title: How to Connect a Fitbit to MyFitnessPal

steps.title: Open MyFitnessPal.
steps.content: Open MyFitnessPal. This app icon features a white leaping person silhouette on a blue background that you can find on one of your Home screens, by searching, or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This button is located at the top left.

steps.title: Tap Apps & Devices.
steps.content: Tap Apps & Devices . This is in the middle of the menu, so you might have to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Tap Fitbit Tracker.
steps.content: Tap Fitbit Tracker . The app's details page will load.

steps.title: Tap Connect.
steps.content: Tap Connect . You'll see this blue button under the app's name.

steps.title: Log in with Fitbit.
steps.content: Log in with Fitbit. A screen will pop-up so you can log-in with Fitbit to continue.

steps.title: Tap to select "Allow All.
steps.content: Tap to select "Allow All. " You'll allow MyFitnessPal to access and write data for your weight, sleep, Fitbit devices and settings, activity and exercise, profile, friends, and food and water logs, from your Fitbit account. To connect your Fitbit account with your MyFitnessPal account, you'll need to allow access to all data points.

steps.title: Tap Allow.
steps.content: Tap Allow . This pink button is under the block of text. If the connection was successful, you'll be redirected to a confirmation page in a web browser.

steps.title: Go to https://www.myfitnesspal.com and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.myfitnesspal.com and log in. You can use any web browser to connect your Fitbit to MyFitnessPal.

steps.title: Click Apps.
steps.content: Click Apps . You'll see this in the horizontal menu that stretches across the top of the page under the page header.

steps.title: Click Get under Fitbit Tracker.
steps.content: Click Get under Fitbit Tracker. You'll see this in the apps available that you can link to your MyFitnessPal account. If you need to, click App Gallery to see the complete list of apps that you can connect to your MyFitnessPal account.

steps.title: Log in with Fitbit.
steps.content: Log in with Fitbit. A screen will pop-up so you can log-in with Fitbit to continue.

steps.content: Click to select "Allow All. " You'll allow MyFitnessPal to access and write data for your weight, sleep, Fitbit devices and settings, activity and exercise, profile, friends, and food and water logs, from your Fitbit account. To connect your Fitbit account with your MyFitnessPal account, you'll need to allow access to all data points.
